Module kivakit.data.formats.csv
Package com.telenav.kivakit.data.formats.csv

Class CsvReader

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.core.collections.iteration.BaseIterator<CsvLine>
com.telenav.kivakit.data.formats.csv.CsvReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Broadcaster, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Listener, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.MessageTransceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Repeater, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.repeaters.RepeaterMixin, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Transceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.io.Closeable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Receiver, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Transmitter, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Nameable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.NamedObject, com.telenav.kivakit.mixins.Mixin, AutoCloseable, Iterator<CsvLine>
Direct Known Subclasses:
UnquotedCsvReader
public class CsvReader extends com.telenav.kivakit.core.collections.iteration.BaseIterator<CsvLine> implements com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.repeaters.RepeaterMixin, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.io.Closeable
Parses a stream of CSV information. The rules outlined here dictate valid CSV format. In particular, this class can handle quoted strings, line breaks within quotes, comments, empty lines, and some of the other standard formatting issues.

Processing CSV Lines

A reader instance is constructed with CsvReader(Resource, CsvSchema, char, ProgressReporter). Since the class is Iterable, lines can then be retrieved as objects with code similar to: 

 try (var reader = new CsvReader(resource, schema, ',', ProgressReporter.none()))
 {
     for (var line : reader)
     {
         var employee = line.asObject(Employee.class);

         [...]
     }
 }
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

    • extractNextColumn

      protected String extractNextColumn(com.telenav.kivakit.core.io.LookAheadReader in)
      Read the next CSV column from the input stream. When exiting this method the input stream should either be pointing to a line end (0x0D), a column end (delimiter), or the end of the stream.
      Parameters:
      in - The input stream to read data from pointing to the start of the CSV column.
      Returns:
      A buffer populated with the column data or null if no more data exists.

    • onNext

      protected CsvLine onNext()
      Specified by:
      onNext in class com.telenav.kivakit.core.collections.iteration.BaseIterator<CsvLine>

    • processLeadingSpaces

      protected void processLeadingSpaces(com.telenav.kivakit.core.io.LookAheadReader in, StringBuffer buffer)
      Trims off the spaces at the beginning of a CSV column and copies them to the buffer.
      Parameters:
      in - The input stream to read from pointing to the start of the spaces.
      buffer - The buffer to be populated with the spaces.

    • readColumn

      protected void readColumn(com.telenav.kivakit.core.io.LookAheadReader in, StringBuffer buffer)
      Reads a standard, non-quoted, CSV column. Note that when the method exits the stream should be pointing to the line terminator, 0x0A, or be exhausted.
      Parameters:
      in - The input stream to read from pointing to the start of the column.
      buffer - The buffer to be populated with the contents of the input data.

    • readQuotedColumn

      protected void readQuotedColumn(com.telenav.kivakit.core.io.LookAheadReader in, StringBuffer buffer)
      Reads a CSV column which begins with a quote. Note that when the method exits the stream should be pointing to the line terminator, 0x0A, or be exhausted.
      Parameters:
      in - The input stream to read from pointing to the starting quote.
      buffer - The buffer to be populated with the contents of the input data.

    • skipLine

      protected void skipLine(com.telenav.kivakit.core.io.LookAheadReader in)
      Advances the input stream to the next line. This method can be used when comments, delimited by '#' are encountered.
      Parameters:
      in - The input stream to be advanced.
